item.content:encoded: $META Chief AI Scientist Yann LeCun: "To people who see the performance of DeepSeek and think: 'China is surpassing the US in AI.' You are reading this wrong. The correct reading is: 'Open source models are surpassing proprietary ones'"

item.content:encoded: ‚ÄúUS companies have clearly in retrospect been Nvidia's willing suckers, happy to pay for more capacity instead of wringing out their own; how many years would it have taken to discover DeepSeek's breakthroughs? No, infrastructure optimization isn't sexy, but it matters‚Äù
item.author: modest proposal

item.content:encoded: Arnault calls Tiffany a 'sleeping beauty' due to mismanagement with profit flat for 10 years pre-acquisition. Proudly says, as a result $LVMUY got the only real American luxury brand very cheap. Profit has doubled & jewelry sales up big. $CFRUY $TIF :)
item.author: Rahul Sharma

item.content:encoded: A pretty exciting day for Progress - the first privately-funded supersonic flight. Still a very difficult path to commercialization, but cost reductions in aerospace have been quite amazing, from drones to rocketry (and esp. Starship) to Starlink and other satellite clusters.

item.content:encoded: A hundred data buyers have spoken and cloud data warehouses are still at the top of the stack. Analytics/BI tools are not too far behind, though. @sigmacomputing

After 15 years of working kinda nonstop, I‚Äôm finally losing a little bit of passion working for someone else
The employer v employee split of the profits doesn‚Äôt in any way account for efforts being put in, and at this point I don‚Äôt feel like doing the same amount of work

item.content:encoded: One of the most interesting discussions I‚Äôve had recently, with @Blake_Hall The first 30 min or so of his backstory in the military will wake you up His views on identity are fascinating Spending time with Blake will make you want to be uncompromising in what you do
item.author: Patrick OShaughnessy

item.content:encoded: 1/ This internal 2007 Nokia presentation on the first iPhone is a really good example of how incumbents actually get disrupted Oftentimes, the incumbent already knows what needs to be done. It's just that organizational incentives inhibit the incumbent from doing it

item.content:encoded: Bezos sold $5bn of $AMZN at $200 in November & July (the famous ‚Äúwall‚Äù). The stock is up 20% since, and he‚Äôd have $1bn more if he waited just a few months. Even the most inside insiders have no clue where their stock will go.
